issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: FATAL message about duplicate configurable fields at bootstrap

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:

comments.body: Have a fix in the branch for eua-9108 fix. will resolve when that fix goes in

Internal: ed49a9be58b65043102a23c24598af9335558811
Eucalyptus: 5600d280dd56ce831325870a558a4d9c6bfa0db5

To verify just look in cloud-output.log on system startup.

Hey [~zhill], as per the issue description, the FATAL error is in the cloud-error.log, I am still seeing this in the cloud-error.log file,

{noformat}
Tue May 13 23:31:26 2014 FATAL [PropertyDirectory:main] [?.?(?):?] java.lang.RuntimeException: Duplicate configurable field in same config file:
-> com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.entities.S3ProviderConfiguration.S3Endpoint
-> com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.entities.S3ProviderConfiguration.S3Endpoint

java.lang.RuntimeException: Duplicate configurable field in same config file:
-> com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.entities.S3ProviderConfiguration.S3Endpoint
-> com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.entities.S3ProviderConfiguration.S3Endpoint

        at com.eucalyptus.configurable.PropertyDirectory.buildPropertyEntry(PropertyDirectory.java:128)
        at com.eucalyptus.configurable.PropertiesDiscovery.processClass(PropertiesDiscovery.java:89)
        at com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.ServiceJarDiscovery.checkClass(ServiceJarDiscovery.java:293)
        at com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.ServiceJarDiscovery.runDiscovery(ServiceJarDiscovery.java:284)
        at com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.ServiceJarDiscovery.runDiscovery(ServiceJarDiscovery.java:276)

{noformat}

{noformat}
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.0.1028.20140514git95f64d28.el6
{noformat}

[~swathi], can you look at this?  I think Zach won't get to it.
[~viglesias] we should decide on this one kicked back from failed verification
[~tjcramer], I can take a look at @zach's commit. From what I last heard, this should've been fixed.

[~shaon], Commit from [~zhill] should have fixed this bug. Is there any chance the cloud-error.log was from before you upgraded the QA system? I'm bringing up a fresh QA setup from testing to verify this.
Just verified that I don't see the FATAL log message after bringing up a fresh 4.0 system from testing.

Fixed. Not seeing in recent packages.
